Love at 1st sip and 1st bite! Bonnie's is a Cantonese American restaurant in Brooklyn that serves nostalgic Hong Kong classic comfort dishes I ate growing up but with an American flare. The restaurant is very reminiscent of a 茶餐厅(Cha Chan Teng, a Hong Kong-style diner) with a very hipster Brooklyn interpretation. Also like a typical Hong Kong style diner, the restaurant was loud and lively.

Great meal at Bonnie's. Squid ($17) were crispy and light. I don't have a wok so this is a dish that I can't make at home. The lettuce bed was not soggy and the ranch dressing was on the runnier side but still good. 9/10. The Cha Siu McRib ($27) was much bigger than a regular McRib at McDonald's. It is a full sandwich. The hoisin sauce adds a smoky flavor and the thick cut pickles are fresh and really help counteract the sweetness and richness of the meat. Be warned that there is hot mustard on this sandwich and it's not evenly distributed so you may get a bite that's much spicier than the other bites. A wasabi-like level of spiciness. It isn't as fatty and juicy like a similarly priced Katz's deli sandwich. With this price, maybe value isn't its strong point, but it's pretty well executed. 8/10. The sundae ($12) was a nice way to end the meal. It's very unique, as the fried malted milk pieces were something I'd not had before. Buttered peanuts added more texture, which was good here. Normally I am hesitant to add nuts to sundaes, for fear that they will hurt the roof of my mouth, but these didn't. They were finely chopped. Ovaltine hot fudge was pretty sparse. I prefer regular hot fudge. 8/10. Service was prompt and friendly. Surprisingly busy on a Tuesday night. Maybe folks are going out to eat more these days, ahead of the transmissible BA5 wave which could elicit new lockdowns.

This is a review I hate to write.  We went because of the NYT review.  While the food was quite good for its type, they do not have their act together yet for Celiac diners who are especially sensitive to gluten cross contamination.  We thought because they listed GF items on the menu it would be safe for Celiac patrons.  Despite being crystal clear about our needs for our Celiac diner, the first dish to arrive was a bean dish with gluten on top.  After getting that straightened out, it became clear that at least the serving staff & maybe the kitchen didn't understand that soy itself does not have gluten but soy sauce does.  The meal didn't sit well with our Celiac diner, so for the time being I would add this to the long list of Chinese restaurants to be avoided if you have Celiac.

If full transparency I am related to Chef Owner Calvin Ng 9n my Mother's side if the family.  The food is traditional Cantonese dishes you would find at a home cooked meal or a dinner out in a old school Cantonese Restaurant in NYC Chinatown. The dishes Bonnie's serves I've ate many times at home cooked by my Grandfather and Mother or at a dinner in Chinatown. Chef Calvin takes these dishes and puts his take on them. The Dao Gok and Cacio E Pepe are both made with a traditional condiment Fuyu which is fermented bean curd. It has a very strong pungent taste but both dishes you only taste a hint of it and melds perfectly. Both dishes was outstanding and the Dao Gok was slightly different from the traditional dish. My favorite dish was the Black bean class with the steam eggs. It's actually two dishes combined. Normally both dishes would be separate entrees. The steam eggs was a perfect custard texture. Everything I ate was delicious but make sure to leave room for the Sundae which was phenomenal. It was awesome meal and hospitality was great. The GM Brad is a great guy. It was touching to see photos of my family adoring a wall. I will be back.

You would think they could come up with a slightly better situation. It took us quite a while to be seated. The food is a little overpriced for what you are getting. Most of the food was a bit over salted. The staff is very pleasant but they are in no rush to get people in and seated. The cocktails were all $15 and apparently pre mixed per our server so we couldn't alter them. I got a Tsingtao which is just a cheap Budweiser style Chinese beer and that was $7. Great experience at Bonnie's. Food was delicious inventive and prepared perfectly. My favorite was the squid, perfectly crispy and super flavorful seasoning. Loved the chicken broth and the mushrooms and sticky rice too. The cacio e pepe was kind of a fun take but leaned more heavily towards being a faithful rendition of the dish. It was really good albeit maybe jived together less with the rest of the meal. The char siu McRib was tasty and prepared well I enjoyed it but I wouldn't go back for it, didn't really do much for me or add anything interesting. I would rather just get an actual char siu bun. The only dish I really didn't super enjoy was the stuffed whole trout. The flavors were nice but the meatloafy consistency wasn't for me. I got the black penicillin cocktail which was excellent. They have some blankets but it's not enclosed enough and the heaters just aren't strong enough for a cold night. Don't think they should offer the outdoor dining in the winter if they don't have the setup to make it comfortable enough. Loved the meal but sitting out on the cold definitely detracted a bit. Absurdity is a perfect word to describe Bonnie's. I am appalled at the prices of the dishes for a poor take at Cantonese food. There is NOTHING that is traditional or authentic about this Cantonese food. If you want culture and authenticity, Bonnie's is not that. The food and prices are fitting for the Williamsburg demographic: a group that has zero knowledge on Cantonese food. None of the staff members are Cantonese let alone Asian. If you want gentrified food that costs more than an arm feel free to go to Bonnie's. Objectively speaking, the taste of the food isn't bad, but the price for what it is is atrocious. These prices really makes the person believe in inflation that's for sure. Got damn walnut shrimp had oranges in it smfh. Better off going to Chinatown, flushing, dyker, 86 st Brooklyn and etc for more authentic food. If you wish to support TRUE culture, this is NOT it. column6: Had an outstanding meal at Oxalis. We opted for the carte blanche menu, which offered 9+ courses thoughtfully created by the chef.  Husband has the non alcoholic beverage pairing which he thoroughly enjoyed. I had the pineapple cocktail which was one of the tastiest cocktails I've had in awhile. Every course was delicious but we especially enjoyed the potato and seafood stew. I'm not sure how to describe it but to say it was savory and delicate and so rich in flavor. We also loved the flounder dish which was so fresh and both the cherry blossoms and green strawberry added so much to the dish. Staff was friendly and informative. Don't miss out on this excellent restaurant.

There are some hits and misses with the carte blanche. Their sourdough was truly phonomenal - crispy on the outside, warm and soft on the inside (it's SO GOOD). Some of the food was simply way too salty for my liking. Flavors at oxalis tend to be bold, and sometimes not matching. One star off for the taste of some of the dishes. But their service is amazing! Their mocktail pairing was also super nice!

I visited Oxalis on a night when they had an event with Suntory Whiskey so there were some extra items on the menu. The food was delicious and drinks were amazing. My husband and I both had drinks from the special menu, and also tried the special dessert the cherry blossom roll. The rest was from their regular menu and we loved all of it, but the lamb collar was slightly underwhelming especially considering it's the most expensive item on the menu. This is an incredible addition to the neighborhood, and I know we will be coming back soon. Make your reservation now before it becomes impossible to get one.

In the 5 years I've lived in New York, probably the best meal I've had. If you like surprises, not having to choose anything about the meal is fun, and the wine pairing was the perfect complement to each dish.
This is the best fine dining in the neighborhood. Bright, airy, not too expensive. It's just so great; fresh and seasonal food, creative plating. I'm so glad it's there for special occasions.
No comment

I would like to review the food at this restaurant but I have been unable thus far to actually eat there. Reservations are as of now not hard to get, but they've canceled me twice. They promised to accommodate me in the future, but it's getting frustrating. I will amend this review to include the food if I ever get to eat it.

I dined at Oxalis shortly after the NY Times review. My Gf was finishing up a sales meeting nearby and she suggested that we try Oxalis. We rarely make reservation's, but we arrived early enough to be seated. The space is very attractive, and it has a very nice vibe. The nabe is full of ues transplants, and on this particular evening it appeared that every one of them had invited their parents to dinner. I thought that I was in La Goulue for a minute. The food is good not great. The wines by the glass were terrible, but the staff were all polite, and very gracious. I guess that they need some time to age and I hope to try Oxalis again in the future.

A superb restaurant with wonderful service and a unique menu featuring inspired use of unusual herbs. It's the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two or a night of fine dining and drinking with old friends. Memorable things: the beautiful greenhouse-like dining area in the back of the restaurant, the herb-infused cocktails, the extraordinarily delicious food, the fact that we could get a table immediately, the prompt and friendly service. Frankly, I'm surprised this place isn't completely overrun by reservations weeks in advance; the food is on par with that of the ever-booked Olmsted around the corner, and in several ways more interesting.

We went for New Years and had an incredible experience. The food was amazing - especially the beef tartar and the poached oysters and the dessert - and the service was superb. The space was beautiful. A world class restaurant in Brooklyn!

First date night away from the baby for the husband's birthday and it was everything. We were treated like royalty just because I let them know we were celebrating- the service was tremendous and one of the owners is right there alongside the staff talking to all the guests. We reserved the dining area where it's tasting menu only- every course was so unique and delicious. As an added bonus, they throw in a couple things not listed. We can't wait to get back and check out the bar room which looked beautiful. Great addition to the neighborhood food scene!

Holiday spirit indeed.  I got food poisoning over thanksgiving and had to cancel my reservation, did so in advance but was told there was a $60 fee.  I explained the situation and this was not a last minute cancellation but no budging.  Would have been nice to get a heads up when I canceled.  Was really looking forward to dining here but a restaurant with no budging/heart is not one I want to support.
No comment

My mother and I stumbled into this gem after visiting the Brooklyn Museum. The prix fixe menu is a bargain for $70. This restaurant would be at home in Manhattan for twice the price. The staff were wonderful and the service was among the best I've experienced in a long time. Every course was a small masterpiece. We loved it and would go back!

Such a great place. Whether you come for the amazing tasting menu which is truly delicious  or to just sit outside and enjoy a cocktail in the garden, Chef Nico, Steve and the amazing staff make this  an unbelievable experience! This place just flows from the moment you are seated to saying goodbye, everything just works beautifully!

Absolutely best dining experience I have had in a long time. Every dish was amazing and my friends and I could not stop talking about it afterwards. For this price point, you have to go. I will definitely be back and bring many people with me. We talked to the chef afterwards and he was so kind and really cannot wait to see the growth of this fabulous restaurant.

Excellent, excellent restaurant. From the attentive and warm staff to the extremely delicious dishes.  We had the tasting menu and for desert we were surprised with candles for our anniversary.  Really loved the delicacy and unique flavors of all the different dishes. It's really rare to find an affordable tasting menu, especially in Brooklyn. I really hope this pop up becomes permanent!

So sorry not to be able to be positive- we were so looking forward to this place. We've been living in Brooklyn for 12 years now. We love good food. One of us grew up in Paris and we love to spend a good buck on dinner - when it's worth it. We got a tiny sized "flatbread " (bad pizza) for $17. The other dishes were fine but still not worth it. Made us feel like gentrification makes us all chumps - a little cabbage with a drizzle of vinegar can be $14 because hey, rent is high. Sadly would not return here again. (On a side note- very nice decor; Service was perfectly good; the wine was fine if overpriced.) Did not stay for dessert.
No comment

Definitely worth a second visit. Their menu prix fixe menu is very high end and worth the $60. They pay great attention to detail and the meal tantalizes your taste buds.The staff is very nice and accommodating. Awesome!!

This place is already packed but it's bound to completely blow up soon. The service, the food, the drinks, the presentation - and the reasonable price for all of these things - everything blew us away. It's truly a gem in the neighborhood. We sat in the bar room and ordered one of each dish, which was perfectly shareable between the 4 of us. The farro and beef in particular were our favorites and the citrus cocktail was so delicious. We will definitely be coming back to try more drinks and the tasting menu.
Really great food with delicious balanced flavours. The waiting staff were really attentive. Highly recommended.

So excited to have another food destination on the Crown/Prospect Heights border! As soon as we stepped inside, we started to understand why Eater had named Oxalis one of the top restaurants in Brooklyn 2019. Gabriel and his staff were charmingly polite and warm. We ordered a la carte: started with flatbread with duck offal (deliciously rich and appropriate for a wintry night) and chicory salad with carmelized anchovy (creamily addictive dressing, even if we were expecting pieces of anchovies); then enjoyed the cabbage with egg yolk (wish I could get the recipe) and grilled beef with horseradish (tender, fresh and filling).   The coffee chocolate cream cheese was heavenly. One of the best meals we've had in a long time. One of Brooklyn's finest in innovative cooking without any fussiness or pretentiousness.

Remarkable experience! Staff amazing.Food incredible! So much fun. HIGHLY recommend! Ok, so Yelp wants me to make my already highly complimentary review longer to actually post it. So I will because, while i hate to type on my phone, I like this restaurant so much. I hope this works.

What a phenomenal experience. I went with my wife for our 1 year anniversary, and the staff treated us like celebrities. The beverage pairing is a must, and the cocktails at the bar were extremely unique and delicious. The food was absolutely excellent, our favorite was the beef shoulder that was cooked for 16 hours and coated with a crunchy herb rub. Highly recommend!

If there was an extra star on yelp, I'd give it. First persons to great us, the Chefs! The food was so good I was texting my (industry sommelier friends) all night long. It's that good. I could have went face first into that mushroom pot-au-feu. Get there before the reviews as it surly will blow up. They don't have a liquor license yet, but send you a recc from their favorite bar. Reserve and go! $60 bucks for a 5 course tasting, in Manhattan $300 easy.
No comment
The Thanksgiving fixed menu was a bit pricey but worth it, the service was excellent and friendly.

Way overpriced for a fine brunch. With so many delicious, well-priced brunch options in the 'hood, we were disappointing here (though staff was all lovely). From past reviews, sounds like dinner is the way to go at Oxalis.

The food was exceptional, the service was impeccable and I highly recommend going for the pre-fixe dinner.  We had both non-alcoholic and normal drink pairing and both were unique and delicious. The duck breast was probably the best I've had.

GO! As simple as that. But in the interest of elaborating: probably the most creative, imaginative and unique combinations of food and tastes; wonderful, smiley staff, great cocktails, and totally reasonable. I think this place should be on most people's lists, and hope it is around for a long time.

Service is super attentive, the food is great, (first course needs a little work, the carrots aren't functional with the toothpick), the n/a beverage tasting is insane. Every one that they give, they gave 4 drinks, went absolutely perfectly with the dish. Kinda wished the sesame cookie was given before dessert because it's really strong and lingers for a long time in your mouth. But seriously, don't sleep on this place. It's going to do great things.

Oxalis was a superb experience from the moment I walked in. Friendly staff (from the open kitchen chefs to host and bartender), pleasant & relaxing ambiance, and delicious food throughout the whole tasting menu. Highly recommend this spot for those that are open to unexpected tasting menus and unique beverage pairings, all for a reasonable price. I definitely plan on bringing more friends here, you don't want to miss this experience!

Best dinner date/restaurant for a special occasion in Brooklyn by a landslide. When we have friends visiting and we are trying to show them the best spots in town, Oxalis ranks at the very top. If you're not a big drinker, they have an *excellent* non-alcoholic drink pairing with the tasting menu. Makes dinner much more accessible when you're with a group of drinkers and non-drinkers. Couldn't recommend Oxalis highly enough.
No comment

Creative menu with lots of unexpected flavors. The tasting menu is a gastronomic feast topped only by the quirky and delicious wines. Excellent staff who really love what they do and enhance the experience with their knowledge and story telling. Truly a gem of a restaurant.

Great vibe and great service. I went here post proposal and my soon to be wife loved it!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND 'NON-ALCOHOLIC' pairing with the meal! In-house sodas were actually better than wine pairing... sounds crazy but one must try to understand what i am saying! So worth it

Behind the frosted glass facade at 791 Washington Ave is Oxalis, where wonderful things are being made and served. This restaurant works perfectly for the part of Brooklyn it's in, which you kind of feel before you even open the door. The quality of the dishes the Oxalis team serve will astound you and are worth every dollar. They do rotating tasting menus, but also offer food and drink off an ala carte menu in the back half of the restaurant. You can tell that Nico and Co. know what they are doing, and also, most importantly, that they care. Being able to watch the chefs and cooks working so diligently in the open kitchen is quite humbling, but also inspiring. I think we could all learn a thing or two about delicious, fresh, new ways of approaching food and it'll be fun to see it happen here. Aspiring chefs, foodies, and regular people of all walks of life, in and out of Brooklyn, should give Oxalis a try. Maybe you'll learn something new, see something great, or just enjoy a nicely prepped and prepared meal, served to you by their nice staff. The last time I ate there, I tired the pig trotter and it was my favorite. I also had a dessert made with cream cheese ice cream, which brought out my inner fat kid, for sure. I'm going backwards now, but the brioche bread was amazeballs. I am really excited for Oxalis in 2019 and can't wait to see what is on the way!
Best restaurant in Brooklyn.  Not to be missed. Beautiful spot, delicious food, lovely and knowledgable staff.  Seriously, go.

I have been to some of the best restaurants in NYC (Eleven Madison Park, Per Se, Le Bernadin, Aska ...) but I was blown away by the inventiveness and quality of the food at Oxalis.  So delicious course after course it is hard to even pick the best.  The creamy farro with snails was unforgettably mouthwateringly creamy and verdant and unique.  The beef tongue was perfectly salty, crispy, crunchy and meaty all at the same time. And the goat cheese dessert was a wonderful end to a memorable meal that I will definitely want to repeat.

We just went to this place for a special anniversary, and we absolutely loved it. Upon making a reservation and noting my dietary restrictions, the manager wrote an email to confirm that they would be preparing a special menu. When we arrived, there was a beautiful table set with a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. They poured us delicious bubbles to celebrate (twice!), and the food was fabulous. It was an amazing meal and the warm and attentive service made us feel right at home. We're excited to go back with friends and family!

Oxalis' food, asthetic, and playlist are incredible!!! I've been here several times and most recently tried the set menu. There was a mushroom dish that was absolutely divine- the broth was incredible I could've had ten bowls of that alone. As of the last time I visited they didn't have s liquor license yet but their non-alcoholic drinks are all so amazing I didn't even care. My favorite drink was the sparking jasmine tea.

We came here on a friends rexommendatjon and w had a fantastic experience. Creative menu, friendly staff and an overall relaxing, but not too quiet, ambiance. The music was also top notch. At the end of the meal we couldn't decide which dish was our favorite and we each nominated two different ones as our personal favorites - which is always a good sign. We will definitely be coming back!

So delicious! We did the $60 tasting menu with the $15 non-alcoholic beverage pairing it was so unique and incredible. On top of amazing food there service was on point, so professional and enthusiastic!  Highly recommend!

I've been lucky enough to eat at many incredible restaurants in New York and while they're great, not many are standouts among the rest. Oxalis is without a doubt, the most pleasant, refreshing and jaw-droppingly delicious meal I've had in years. The food was otherworldly. We had the prix fixe and each dish was better than the last. The service was fantastic as was the atmosphere. I have a ton of food allergies to raw whole fruits and vegetables (I know, my life sucks) and they were so accommodating and created two entirely different dishes for me (though what my family ate for those courses was apparently also fantastic). To top it all off, the dessert (goat milk with honey and thyme - trust me, totally different than what you're probably imagining right now) was perhaps the best dessert I've had in my life and I've come to to the realization that was the peak of my dessert journey and I'm fine with that. Overall, a magical, warm, inviting, flavorful, surprising experience. Side note: try their Jasmine Tea Soda (WOW!).

Really good, but I know Americans aren't used to paying more for higher quality Indian food which comes at a premium. I got the bhaji pav ($13.99) which was really really good. The spice was on point and I could literally tell by eating it that the ingredients were just of a higher quality. Of course as one knows with places where the quality is good, the portion size of the dishes are smaller. But to be honest, I think it is good because usually portion sizes at restaurants are inflated. I will come back occasionally due to the price point.

We went the for Saturday dinner had Masala Dosa and masala chai. This was good food and liked the decor of the restaurant.

My dreams of having shiv sagar type restaurants in NY, have been answered. This place is AMAZING! we have tried pretty much all the dishes on the menu. My favorites however are the pani puri, bhel puri, bhakri pizza with amul cheese and bahubali sandwich. This will be a constant till I live in Manhattan.

I visited NYC yesterday and the person next to me was an Indian from an area close Delhi. and in talking about pav bhaji, she recommended Honest as a great place for that and vegetarians. Unfortunately, when I went I was rather full from a late lunch so just had some samosas, what struck me was how fresh they were, delicious. Honest serves vegetarian Indian street food and it feels and looks that way. I know a lot about Indian food but I am not an Indian, but it strikes me that the  food here would be a cure from homesickness by someone from India. Will definitely come back.
No comment

HIGHLY recommend coming to Honest for some delectable chaat!! Honestly, the food tasted like the street stalls in India. I tried the vada pav, kattappa sandwich, dahi puri, and pav bhaji - and oh my god, every bit was so so good. The staff is very friendly, and the food is very fresh and tastes amazing. I've tried chaat at quite a few places in NYC, and I don't think many places compare to Honest. The restaurant is cute, chic, and I love the instagrammable sign that they have inside. Great place to hangout with friends, for a quick bite, or a nice dinner. I will definitely be coming back again to try more!
No comment

Loved everything we ordered here - pau bhaji, and special pizza. They even made a small size sada dosa for my one year old and she relished it! Great quality with great taste. The place was very clean and neat. Loved the ambiance. Coming back for sure!

This place is a gem. Love that it's right in the middle of the west village and has affordable prices. If you are an NYU student you can get an additional discount ! The food was amazing and portions were huge. I recommend going family style and sharing a few dishes.

Small, unassuming place, order at front and they bring your food to your table.  It's definitely different than typical Indian food. They call it Street Food. The plates are small and meant to be shared. Everything seemed fresh, nothing frozen or reheated. Good quality ingredients. Started with bhaji pav, which is kind of a loose mashed potato curry served with buttery rolls for dipping. It was pretty tasty. We then had some samosas which I thought were just ok. Then we had paneer chili gravy which was grilled paneer cheese with veggies in a spicy sauce. That was my favorite dish. Also got something called a mango falooda which is kind of like a mango lassi but with nuts, mango ice cream, and thin noodles. Apparently it's a very popular  Indian street drink. My friend and I really didn't care for it. It actually wasn't bad, but those noodles were pretty off-putting for us. Maybe it's an acquired taste. Overall, an interesting meal, the restaurant was basic but very clean and bright and pretty, and the service was very good. But the food itself, while interesting, wasn't actually that great. I'm glad I tried it, but wouldn't rush to go back.

Perfect place for Indian chat around Greenwich area. Their menu options are great for street food nostalgia and the taste is original. As 'Desi' as it could get. I had the Samosa Chat and it was amazing .

This place caught my eye when I walked by it. Vibrant and colorful which I love. I decided to go in and was greeted very friendly. I asked what was good on the menu and was offered a few suggestions. I ended up picking the Bhaji Pav and the Hangover juice (lemon, ginger, carrot). You could sit anywhere which is pretty cool. The decor is spacious, bright, and inviting. I ended up sitting in the back to look at the backyard view which was nice. A kind woman brought my food to me and saw I was taking selfies which she asked if she can take the picture for me instead. The pictures she took were so lovely! I appreciate her lol The food and juice overall were delicious. It was a very calming environment to eat in. I definitely will come back and recommend it!
Highly recommend this vegetarian restaurant! Must try the pau bhaji with cheese and the dabang dosa!
No comment

most horrible customer service. Our order was wrongly served to another customer and we kept waiting forever for it to arrive. the server girl realized it.  But gave us no update and neither any apology for the delayed service!!! very rude and proud girls man the restaurant. I wonder if they will ever get a return customer. The whole time that we were waiting, we were hearing loud conversations amongst the girls in the kitchen about their personal life. No wonder the mistake! Owners please be aware of what is going on in your business.
Dropped in for a quick paani poori. Honestly I can make them much better and I don't know how to cook.
SO good. My favorite desi street food in the city, tastes like I'm eating roadside in Ahmedabad!

I have a nut allergy and they assured me their samosas were nut free after explaining my allergy to the person working there. Within minutes of eating the food, I had a severe allergic reaction and had to be hospitalised. First time in my life having to use an epi pen and spent hours in the ER. I will never eat here again!!!!

Great food. Loved the dabang dosa, pani puri. Also the person at counter was suuuuper nice and very kindly made the best recommendations. He was also thoughtful enough to space out my large order appropriately so I have the best experience. Can't wait for them to open more of the restaurants in the city.

'Honest Indian Restaurant' is a great addition to the Greenwich Village area. The interior is very spacious, clean, and aesthetic - with lots of murals and art decor. Everything on the menu is vegetarian. We tried a variety of dishes - Kattappa, Veg Hakka Noodle, Samosa Chaat, Pav Bhaji, and Pani Puri. The Bhaji Pav and Samosa Chaat was my favorite. Pav Bhaji is their signature dish, so I had to try it! It was a simple, homey dish. Every bite of the Samosa Chaat was loaded with flavor - sauce, chickpea, vegetables, and fruits (pomegranate and apples).

Doesn't look like much when you pass by but OMG is this place good. Reminds me of my moms home cooking! I'll be coming at least once a week!

The food was very tasty and place was modern, clean and spacious. We had the plain dosa, gobi manchurian, pav bhaji, dahi puri, falooda and chai. Everything was delicious. It has the same quality and taste as chaat that you would get in India.
Really good, quick service, and friendly staff! Friend had the mango lassi and said it was great too

This is basically an Indian fast food restaurant. Best for a quick lunch. The food is just okay. They say it's Indian street food, so it's not to be confused with what you would expect from a typical Indian restaurant.

I picked up the Dabang Dosa and the Vada Pav for dinner last night and it was incredible. The sambhar for the dosa was so so good, didn't care much for the coconut chutney. The food was so good that I ordered the Pav Bhaji and the Kattappa Sandwich for lunch today, and once again, they were both so delicious. The texture and the taste of the pav bhaji gravy was perfect. The Kattappa sandwich could have been more spicy but it was really really good. I'm going to try literally everything on their menu. I'm Indian and I definitely recommend this place.
Delicious.  I had the chili paneer (dry) and the kaju anjeer milkshake, and they were extremely tasty.  I'm so excited to have a good chaat + Indo-Chinese place in the West Village!

Ate here for lunch. The Bhaji Pav is incredible and perfectly spiced. Surprisingly large inside; I was able to set up my laptop on my table while I ate. Great background music. I expect to come here a lot!
Had a wonderful experience at Honest. Tied thali, puri, pao bhaji, dosa, kulfi. Great food, great service.
I visited this location twice while I was on vacation in NYC. Food was amazingggg. Location was clean and service was nice. I wish we had Honest here in Arizona lol.  Must try, if you are in NYC.
I loved every single bite oft paneer roll! Really good flavoring, super fresh and tasty.

So glad I stopped in to try this new place in our neighborhood! We had the Bhaji Pav, the Manchurian dumplings, and the samosas. Everything was delicious and there's lots on their menu I'd like to try next time. You can ask for different spice levels if you'd like, and pretty much anything can be made vegan- and there are so many interesting vegetarian options! Your food is made fresh when you order. It was great.
Classic honest. Pav bhaji cannot disappoint. Glad we have this one in NYC now. One of the best places for Indian food in the city.
